comment: Sweet and wants every student to do well. Participation really does matter in her class. There are a large number of assignments but I'm sure that's for all the Korean courses here at KSU. The assignments are very similar to what we had to do in KOR1001. LockDown Browser on all Lesson Tests and Midterm but not the quizzes. Strict with attendance.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Participation matters

comment: The absolute best teacher I've ever had!! She's super caring and really wants the best for her students. During my online final, I was super nervous and at the end she told me I did well and she'd let me know if I needed to do extra credit for an A (but probably not). She's super accessible outside of class and will answer any questions!

She is a great teacher! She's only been at KSU for a year now and she rocks! Only two group projects, some HW assignments, some quizzes here & there & 4 tests but they're easy if you study the material. A midterm and final exam but the study guide will help you immensely so use it. Super caring so don't be scared to talk to her or ask for help.
her class was very easy, if you try and do your work you'll pass with an a. she's a very sweet lady and is always willing to help. i love her and want to take her for the second korean class

Professor Cho is amazing!! She's easy to understand, easy to access outside of the classroom, and her classes have a relaxed, fun atmosphere! I loved her so much that I'm taking her KOR 1002 course too. Take her!!

I took Korean because I thought it may useful, however i wasn't quite prepared on how the curriculum was set up. Basically you'll have to memorize the 15-25 vocab words before each quiz which every time you'll have class. Plus you'll have three projects due. Two group and one by yourself. Other than the curriculum set up she's a wonderful professor

I love Professor Cho, she is a good choice when starting learn Korean. Not only does she teach you based off of the textbook but she also teaches you everyday words. Professor Cho allows 2 absences, she takes attendance every class. She is very understanding and if you miss a day she'll allow you to retake the quizzes.
